results.title: Thirst
results.creator_credit: Robin Hughes, Film Australia and Graham Chase
results.brief_description: One of three films as part of the National Drug Education Program which take an in-depth view of drug addiction in the day-to-day lives of ordinary people. Bob, a travelling salesman in children’s wear is an alcoholic. Although his is a loving family, his drinking and gambling cause his wife great stress and anguish. His drinking leaves him with little or nothing for housekeeping and expenses as he often “drinks” away his wages. Bob wants to lead a normal life and “tomorrow he’ll be sober”, but for him, tomorrow never comes. Photography by Dean Semler. (See also “All in the same boat” T/C 012758 and “Hassles” T/C 012851).

results.title: Brett and friends stick to a job: Brett and Greg
results.brief_description: This tape contains two programs entitled “Brett and Friends - Why stick to a job?” and “Brett and Greg - what are the options?” Brett and friends sets the context for Brett and Greg and should be viewed first. The two programs represent the viewpoints of Brett and Greg and their friends, some of whom had been unemployed for several months at the time of taping

results.title: The Southern edge: marsh and mangroves
results.creator_credit: Robert Horne, Michael Vance and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Shows the dependence of Westernport Bay on the fringing salt-marsh and mangroves. We see the organisms of these vegetations in their natural surroundings and in the laboratory. Illustrates the density and diversity of the wildlife, and the changes along a transect from saltmarsh to sea. Narrated by Ross Thompson and introduced by Charles McCubbin.

results.title: The Year of the Kings
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
The final program in this series traces a full year’s life cycle of the King Penguin. These birds have had to adapt to a harsh environment on Macquarie Island, and have developed a well-organised social structure.

results.title: Quiet challenge
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Concerned about Australia’s lack of success in international sports aviation events, ex-businessman Bill Reilly has established a school for advanced glider-pilot training at Tokamore, N.S.W. Resident championship Ingo Reuner, aeronautical pilot and Bert Persson, engineer, display their skills and explain the fascination that gliding holds for them.

results.title: Chorus and principals on stage please
results.brief_description: A co-production by Film Australia and the Australian Opera, this film of compelling interest to opera-lovers features throughout Australian stars Joan Sutherland and Richard Bonynge. We are taken behind the Sydney Opera House curtain to explore many of the preparations required to stage such an opera as “Lakma”. With shooting undertaken in Sydney and New York the film leaves a lively impression of the problems of running an opera

results.title: Lyrebird: master of mimicry
results.brief_description: Lyrebirds in Sherbrooke Forest in the Dandenong Ranges, Victoria. Shows the lyrebirds displaying their powers of mimicry - the sounds they emit are extremely varied and cover a large vocal range. Few animals call for such a long period. They imitate all the other birds of the forest, the whip bird, kookaburra, a flock of rosellas and many others. Also includes their own distinctive calls and dance.

results.title: Strange creature: the echidna
results.creator_credit: David Corke, Educational Media Australia and CSIRO
results.brief_description: A simplified version for schools and general audiences of the prize-winning CSIRO film “The Echidna”. Experienced naturalists have seen for the first time in this film the young echidna in its mother’s pouch at different stages of growth. Highlights its uniqueness as an egg-laying mammal and shows the echidna in its natural habitat, feeding, reproductive techniques and development of the young.

results.title: Vine grafting
results.brief_description: Deals with several methods of cutting and grafting for production of Phylloxera resistant grapevine canes in the north of Victoria. The film shows the activities of the staff of the Rutherglen research station inside the sheds and in the field, planting and propagating the canes.

results.title: This little pig went to market
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Luci Clark, South Australian Film Corporation and Newfilms
results.brief_description: Carcass classification has taken much of the guesswork out of pig marketing. As a more objective measure in assessing the quality of the pork, classification is better for both producer and consumer. Explains the benefits to the farmer, and the way modern computers program and store production details. Cast includes Brian Moore, Flo Watson, Peter Brechin, Darcy Button, Keith Arnfield.
